deploy:functions.summary: Deploy a Salesforce Function to an org from your local project.
deploy:functions.description: You must run this command from within a git repository. Only committed changes to Functions are deployed. The active branch is deployed unless specified otherwise with `--branch`.
examples:
Deploy a Salesforce Function:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --connected-org org-alias

Deploy to 'deploy-branch':
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --connected-org org-alias --branch deploy-branch

Overwrite the remote repository:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --connected-org org-alias --force

connected-org.name: connected-org
connected-org.description: Username or alias for the org that the compute environment should be connected to.

branch.name: branch
branch.description: Deploy the latest commit from a branch different from the currently active branch.

force.name: force
force.description: Ignore warnings and overwrite remote repository (not allowed in production).

quiet.name: quiet
quiet.description: Limit the amount of output displayed from the deploy process.

env:delete.description:
You must include the name of the environment to delete using '--target-compute'. Run 'sf env list' to see a list of environments.

Running this command will prompt a confirmation. If you want to skip this confirmation, use the '--confirm' flag and the environment alias to skip confirmation.
examples:
Delete a compute environment:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-alias

Delete without a confirmation step:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-alias --confirm environment-alias

env:log.summary: Stream log output for an environment.
examples:
Stream log output:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-alias

target-compute.name: target-compute
target-compute.description: Compute environment name to retrieve logs.

generate:function.summary: Create a Salesforce Function with basic scaffolding specific to a given language.
generate:function.description: Both '--language' and '--name' are required flags. Function names must start with a capital letter.
examples:
Create a JavaScript function:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --function-name myfunction --language javascript

function-name.name: function-name
function-name.description: Function name. Must start with a capital letter.

name.name: name
name.description: Function name. Must start with a capital letter.

language.name: language
language.description: Language. Can be one of: javascript, typescript, java.

login:functions.description: This step is required to develop or deploy Salesforce Functions.
examples:
Log in to Salesforce Functions:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %>

logout:functions.summary: Log out of your Salesforce Functions account.
examples:
Log out:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %>

run:function.summary: Send a cloudevent to a function.
examples:
Run a function:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --url http://path/to/function

Run a function with a payload and a JSON response:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --url http://path/to/function --payload '@file.json' --structured

function-url.name: function-url
function-url.description: URL of the function to run.

url.name: url
url.description: URL of the function to run.

payload.name: payload
payload.description: Set the payload of the cloudevent as a JSON object or a path to a file via @file.json.

structured.name: structured
structured.description: Set the cloudevent to be emitted as a structured JSON cloudevent.

connected-org.name: connected-org
connected-org.description: Username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org.

whoami:functions.summary: Show information on your Salesforce Functions login.
whoami:functions.description: Returns your email and ID. Use '--show-token' to show your Salesforce Functions token.
examples:
Get account information:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %>

Show token and output result as JSON:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --show-token --json

env:create:compute.summary: Create a compute environment for use with Salesforce Functions.
env:create:compute.description: Compute environments must be connected to a Salesforce org. By default the command uses your local environment's connected org. Use the '--connected-org' flag to specify a specific org. Run 'sf env list' to see a list of environments.
examples:
Create a compute environment to run Salesforce Functions:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %>

Connect the environment to a specific org:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --connected-org=org-alias

Create an alias for the compute environment:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --alias environment-alias

connected-org.name: connected-org
connected-org.description: Username or alias for the org that the compute environment should be connected to.

env:log:tail.summary: Stream log output for an environment.
examples:
Stream log output:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-alias

target-compute.name: target-compute
target-compute.description: Compute environment name to retrieve logs.

env:logdrain:add.summary: Add log drain to a specified environment.
env:logdrain:add.description: Both '--target-compute' and '--url' are required flags. '--url' should be a HTTP or HTTPS URL that can receive the log drain messages.
examples:
Add a log drain:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-name --url https://path/to/logdrain

drain-url.name: drain-url
drain-url.description: Endpoint that will receive sent logs.

url.name: url
url.description: Endpoint that will receive sent logs.

env:logdrain:list.summary: List log drains connected to a specified environment.
examples:
List log drains:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-alias

List log drains as json:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-alias --json

env:logdrain:remove.summary: Remove log drain from a specified environment.
examples:
Remove a logdrain:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-alias --url https://path/to/logdrain

env:var:get.summary: Display a single config variable for an environment.
env:var:get.description: You must provide the '--target-compute' flag and the key to retrieve.
examples:
Get a config variable:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> [KEY] --target-compute environment-alias

env:var:list.summary: List your environment's config vars in a table.
env:var:list.description: Use the '--json' flag to return config vars in JSON format.
examples:
List config vars:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-alias

List in JSON format:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-alias --json

env:var:set.summary: Set a single config value for an environment.
examples:
Set a config value:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> [KEY]=[VALUE] --target-compute environment-alias

env:var:unset.summary: Unset a single config value for an environment.
env:var:unset.description: Run 'sf env var list' to see a list of config values that can be unset.
examples:
Unset a value:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --target-compute environment-alias

login:functions:jwt.summary: Login using JWT instead of default web-based flow. This will authenticate you with both sf and Salesforce Functions.
login:functions:jwt.description: Use this command when executing from a script.
examples:
Log in using JWT:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --username example@username.org --keyfile file.key --clientid 123456

Log in and specify the org alias and URL, set as default org and default Dev Hub, and format output as JSON:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --username example@username.org --keyfile file.key --clientid 123456 --alias org-alias --set-default --set-default-dev-hub --instance-url https://path/to/instance --json

instance-url.name: instance-url
instance-url.description: The login URL of the instance the org lives on.

instanceurl.name: instanceurl
instanceurl.description: The login URL of the instance the org lives on.

set-default.name: set-default
set-default.description: Set the org as the default that all org-related commands run against.

set-default-dev-hub.name: set-default-dev-hub
set-default-dev-hub.description: Set the org as the default Dev Hub for scratch org creation.

run:function:start.summary: Build and run a Salesforce Function.
run:function:start.description:
Run this command from the directory of your Salesforce Functions project.

This command will run the target function locally (on the same operating system as this CLI), just like the `local` subcommand.

Previously, this command ran functions in a container. Container mode is still supported via the `container` subcommand. Arguments relevant to container mode are still accepted, but are deprecated, ignored, and will be dropped in a future release.
examples:
Build a function and start the invoker
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %>

Start the invoker with a specific language and port
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --port 5000 --language javascript

language.name: language
language.description: The language that the function runs in.

env:compute:collaborator:add.summary: Add a Heroku user as a collaborator on this Functions account, allowing them to attach Heroku add-ons to compute environments.
examples:
Add a Heroku user as a collaborator on this Functions account.
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --heroku-user example@heroku.com

heroku-user.name: heroku-user
heroku-user.description: Email address of the Heroku user you're adding as a collaborator.

run:function:start:container.summary: Build and run a Salesforce Function in a container.
run:function:start:container.description: Run this command from the directory of your Salesforce Functions project.
examples:
Build and run a function:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %>

Run a function on a specific port with additional logs:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --port 5000 --verbose

Add environment variables and specify a network:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --env KEY=VALUE --network host

no-pull.name: no-pull
no-pull.description: Skip pulling builder image before use.

env.name: env
env.description: Set environment variables (provided during build and run).

network.name: network
network.description: Connect and build containers to a network. This can be useful to build containers which require a local resource.

descriptor.name: descriptor
descriptor.description: Path to project descriptor file (project.toml) that contains function and/or bulid configuration.

run:function:start:local.description: Build and run a Salesforce Function locally.
examples:
Build a function and start the invoker
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %>

Start the invoker with a specific language and port
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --port 5000 --language javascript

port.name: port
port.description: Port to bind the invoker to.

debug-port.name: debug-port
debug-port.description: Port to use for debbugging the function.

language.name: language
language.description: The language that the function runs in.
